Application_Facts: Applicant feared persecution by FARC after being asked to assist with smuggling; fled to Canada and sought refugee status
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Defendant_Behavior: Board found applicant not credible and identified Bogota as a safe internal flight alternative
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of applicant, existence of internal flight alternative
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review challenging Board’s credibility and internal flight alternative findings
Evidence_Used: Country condition reports, applicant's testimony, contradictory evidence
Application_Basis: Well-founded fear of persecution by non-state actor (FARC)
Evidence_Assessed: Applicant's testimony, documentary evidence on conditions in Colombia
Relief_Sought: Recognition as a Convention refugee and permanent resident status
Governing_Rule: Reasonableness requires deference unless decision falls outside acceptable range
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm from FARC if returned to Colombia
Cause_Description: Applicant feared persecution by FARC after being recruited for smuggling activities
Evidence_Handling: Board relied on country reports despite contradictory evidence
Evidence_Issues: Contradictory evidence presented but Board's interpretation deemed reasonable
Residency_Compliance: Applicant entered Canada and applied for refugee status
Evidence_Assessment: Board reasonably assessed credibility and safety of internal flight alternative
Decision_Rationale: Decision was within the range of reasonable outcomes based on evidence
